revised_title: Anderson Localization in Silicon Inversion Layers: The Effect of Substrate Bias and Long-Range Potential Fluctuations
tldr: This paper investigates the Anderson transition in silicon inversion layers and discusses the origin of Anderson localization. The authors provide evidence for the existence of both negative and positive charges at the interface and propose a model that explains the conflicting reports on the value of minimum metallic conductivity. They suggest that in a two-dimensional system, long-range potential fluctuations increase the minimum metallic conductivity above the value predicted for short-range potential fluctuations.
